vialab.SMT

Class Touch

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.Touch

  • public class Touch
extends java.lang.Object
    Touch has state information of one touch and extends TuioCursor.
    See Also:
    TuioCursor Javadoc

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      TUIO.TuioTime assignTime
      The time at which the TuioCursor/Touch was assigned
      TUIO.TuioTime currentTime
      The current time of the TuioCursor/Touch
      int cursorID
      The individual cursor ID number that is assigned to each TuioCursor.
      TUIO.TuioTime deathTime
      The time at which the TuioCursor/Touch was unassigned
      boolean isDown
      True means the touch is currently down on the screen, false means that the touch has been lifted up.
      float motionAcceleration
      The motion acceleration value.
      float motionSpeed
      The motion speed value.
      java.util.Vector<TUIO.TuioPoint> path
      A Vector of TuioPoints containing all the previous positions of the TUIO component.
      long sessionID
      The unique session ID number that is assigned to each TUIO object or cursor.
      TUIO.TuioTime startTime
      The start time of the TuioCursor/Touch
      int state
      Reflects the current state of the TuioComponent.
      TUIO.TuioTime unassignTime
      The time at which the TuioCursor/Touch was unassigned
      int x
      The X coordinate in pixels relative to the PApplet screen width.
      float xSpeed
      The X-axis velocity value.
      int y
      The Y coordinate in pixels relative to the PApplet screen height.
      float ySpeed
      The Y-axis velocity value.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Touch(TUIO.TuioCursor tuioCursor)
      This constructor takes the attributes of the provided TuioCursor and assigns these values to the newly created Touch.
      Touch(TUIO.TuioTime ttime, long sessionID, int cursorID, float xCoord, float yCoord)
      This constructor takes a TuioTime argument and assigns it along with the provided Session ID, Cursor ID, X and Y coordinate to the newly created Touch.

        Parameters:

      • getPointOnPath

        public java.awt.Point getPointOnPath(int index)
        Gets a Point on the Touch's path history
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the point on the Touch's path (0 is first Point, Touch.path.size()-1 is the current Point)
        Returns:
        A Point containing the x,y values of the Touch's path at the specified index, returns null if invalid index
